channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2024021386
item.description:
Report X-2024021386

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being processed when it was noticed that it had been leaking. Package was placed in a bin to contain the spillage and placed in the appropriate area for further handling. DescribePack: There was a small section of one of the bottom corners that was wet. Other than that, there was no external damage to the package. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in a bin and then onto a liquid pallet to contain any further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024020961
item.description:
Report X-2024020961

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the van in wet/crushed condition. Upon further inspection, found 4 of 8 contents to have had loose caps which caused leakage. Remaining 4 items were stained with leakage from surrounding contents. All contents were placed into a cleanup bin to be taken to a QA cage for further inspection. The spillage on the van was neutralized by Amphomag Spill Neutralizer and was swept into a cleanup bin. DescribePack: 4 of 8 inner packaging bottles had loose caps which caused leakage throughout packaging. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: As soon as spillage was known, cleanup and neutralization processes were immediately performed to prevent further leakage.
